question: 先日
sourceMnemonic: The <kanji>previous</kanji> <kanji>day</kanji> isn't necessarily yesterday. It can be any recent day, which is why this word means <vocabulary>the other day</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since <ja>日</ja> has two on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you remember which one to use:

<vocabulary>The other day</vocabulary>, you saw two <reading>cen</reading>taurs! <reading>Gee, two</reading> (<ja>せんじつ</ja>) of them?! You're lucky you're still alive!
